titles.title: A bill to minimize the economic and social costs resulting from losses of life, property, well-being, business activity, and economic growth associated with extreme weather events by ensuring that the United States is more resilient to the impacts of extreme weather events in the short- and long-term, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S8204)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
